laureates.name: Albert Einstein
laureates.summary: Albert Einstein (14 March 1879 – 18 April 1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. His work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science. He received the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics for his explanation of the photoelectric effect.
facts: Awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics (1921)
Developed the theory of relativity
Formulated the mass–energy equivalence formula E=mc²
Made significant contributions to quantum mechanics and cosmology
Known as one of the most influential physicists of the 20th century

articles.title: On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies

laureates.name: Marie Curie
laureates.summary: Marie Curie (born Maria Salomea Skłodowska; 7 November 1867 - 4 July 1934) was a Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person and only woman to win the Nobel Prize twice, and the only person to win the Nobel Prize in two scientific fields.
facts: First woman to win a Nobel Prize (Physics, 1903)
Discovered the elements polonium and radium
Developed theory of radioactivity
Founded the Curie Institutes in Paris and Warsaw
Only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences

laureates.name: John Bardeen
laureates.summary: John Bardeen (23 May 1908 – 30 January 1991) was an American physicist and electrical engineer. He was the only person to win the Nobel Prize in Physics twice: first in 1956 for the invention of the transistor, and again in 1972 for the theory of superconductivity.
facts: Co-invented the transistor (Nobel Prize in Physics, 1956)
Developed the BCS theory of superconductivity (Nobel Prize in Physics, 1972)
Only person to have won the Nobel Prize in Physics twice
Worked at Bell Labs and the University of Illinois
Contributed significantly to the advancement of electronics and quantum theory

laureates.name: Linus Pauling
laureates.summary: Linus Pauling (28 February 1901 – 19 August 1994) was an American chemist, biochemist, and peace activist. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1954 for his research into the nature of the chemical bond and its application to the elucidation of the structure of complex substances, and later won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1962 for his activism against nuclear weapons testing.
facts: Awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (1954)
Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize (1962)
Studied the nature of the chemical bond
One of the founders of quantum chemistry and molecular biology
Only person awarded two unshared Nobel Prizes

articles.title: The Nature of the Chemical Bond

laureates.name: Malala Yousafzai
laureates.summary: Malala Yousafzai (born 12 July 1997) is a Pakistani education activist and the youngest-ever Nobel Prize laureate. She received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 for her struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education.
facts: Youngest-ever Nobel Prize laureate (Peace, 2014)
Survived an assassination attempt by the Taliban
Founded the Malala Fund to promote education for girls
Advocate for women's rights globally
Co-authored the memoir 'I Am Malala'

laureates.name: Nelson Mandela
laureates.summary: Nelson Mandela (18 July 1918 – 5 December 2013) was a South African anti-apartheid revolutionary and political leader who served as President of South Africa from 1994 to 1999. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993 for his efforts to dismantle the apartheid regime and establish multiracial elections.
facts: First black President of South Africa
Spent 27 years in prison for fighting apartheid
Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize (1993)
Symbol of global peace and reconciliation
Author of 'Long Walk to Freedom'

laureates.name: Mother Teresa
laureates.summary: Mother Teresa (26 August 1910 – 5 September 1997), born Anjezë Gonxhe Bojaxhiu, was an Albanian-Indian Roman Catholic nun and missionary. She was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979 for her humanitarian work with the poor and dying in Kolkata (Calcutta), India.
facts: Founded the Missionaries of Charity
Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize (1979)
Known for her work with the sick and poor in India
Beatified and later canonized as a saint
Became a global symbol of compassion and selflessness

laureates.name: J.J. Thomson
laureates.summary: J.J. Thomson (18 December 1856 – 30 August 1940) was an English physicist and Nobel laureate in Physics in 1906 for his discovery of the electron and for his work on the conduction of electricity in gases.
facts: Discovered the electron (1897)
Awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics (1906)
Pioneered research in atomic structure
Directed the Cavendish Laboratory at Cambridge
Mentored several future Nobel laureates

articles.title: On the Structure of the Atom
